title: Question 4

children: A 66-year-old woman is evaluated for increasing oxygen requirements over the past 18 hours. She developed hypercapnic respiratory failure requiring intubation 7 days ago following a colectomy for colon cancer. Suctioned sputum has become thicker. Medical history is significant for moderately severe COPD and right leg cellulitis, which was treated with cefazolin 1 month ago. Medications are albuterol, tiotropium bromide, and salmeterol-fluticasone inhalers.
On physical examination, temperature is 38.4 °C (101.1 °F); other vital signs are normal.
